humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides the tumor size as 3.5 cm, which falls within the range for T2 tumors (more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm). The tumor type is poorly differentiated invasive ductal carcinoma, and the T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, ignoring any substaging information. Therefore, the pathologic T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The pathologic T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the tumor diameter is specified as 3.5 cm. According to the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) staging system, a T2 designation is given to tumors that are greater than 2 cm but not greater than 5 cm in size. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
